intro: Saxifraga nyanangensis, commonly known as the Nyanangensis saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa, particularly in Kenya and Tanzania. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and fleshy, basal leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring, typically in clusters at the ends of its stems. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
